group.name: Additional Development
group.description: Additional development headers and libraries for building open-source applications.

group.name: Backup Client
group.description: Client tools for connecting to a backup server and doing backups.

group.name: Backup Server
group.description: Software to centralize your infrastructure's backups.

group.name: Base
group.description: The basic installation of CentOS Linux.

group.name: Compatibility Libraries
group.description: Compatibility libraries for applications built on previous versions of CentOS Linux.

group.name: Conflicts (Client)
group.description: This group includes packages conflicting with @everything installation on the Client variant.

group.description: This group includes packages conflicting with @everything installation on the ComputeNode variant.

group.description: This group includes packages conflicting with @everything installation on the Server variant.

group.name: Conflicts (Workstation)
group.description: This group includes packages conflicting with @everything installation on the Workstation variant.

group.name: Console Internet Tools
group.description: Console internet access tools, often used by administrators.

group.name: Core
group.description: Smallest possible installation.

group.name: Debugging Tools
group.description: Tools for debugging misbehaving applications and diagnosing performance problems.

group.name: Desktop Debugging and Performance Tools
group.description: GUI tools for debugging applications and performance.

group.name: Development Tools
group.description: A basic development environment.

group.name: Dial-up Networking Support
group.description: Tools for connecting via WWAN, PPP or ISDN.

group.name: Directory Client
group.description: Clients for integration into a network managed by a directory service.

group.name: Directory Server
group.description: Machine and user identity servers.

group.name: DNS Name Server
group.description: This package group allows you to run a DNS name server (BIND) on the system.

group.name: Emacs
group.description: The GNU Emacs extensible, customizable, text editor.

group.name: File and Storage Server
group.description: CIFS, SMB, NFS, iSCSI, iSER, and iSNS network storage server.

group.name: Fonts
group.description: Fonts for rendering text in a variety of languages and scripts.

group.name: FTP Server
group.description: Allows the system to act as an FTP server.

group.name: GNOME Applications
group.description: A set of commonly used GNOME Applications.

group.name: GNOME
group.description: GNOME is a highly intuitive and user friendly desktop environment.

group.name: Graphical Administration Tools
group.description: Graphical system administration tools for managing many aspects of a system.

group.name: Graphics Creation Tools
group.description: Software for creation and manipulation of still images.

group.name: Guest Agents
group.description: Agents used when running under a hypervisor.

group.name: Guest Desktop Agents
group.description: Agents used when running as a virtualized desktop.

group.name: High Availability
group.description: Infrastructure for highly available services and/or shared storage.

group.name: Hardware Monitoring Utilities
group.description: A set of tools to monitor server hardware.

group.name: Identity Management Server
group.description: Centralized management of users, servers and authentication policies.

group.name: Infiniband Support
group.description: Software designed for supporting clustering and grid connectivity using RDMA-based InfiniBand and iWARP fabrics.

group.name: Input Methods
group.description: Software for the input of international text.

group.name: Internet Applications
group.description: Email, chat, and video conferencing software.

group.name: Internet Browser
group.description: Firefox web browser.

group.name: Java Platform
group.description: Java support for the CentOS Linux Server and Desktop Platforms.

group.name: KDE Applications
group.description: A set of commonly used KDE Applications.

group.name: KDE
group.description: The KDE Plasma Workspaces, a highly-configurable graphical user interface which includes a panel, desktop, system icons and desktop widgets, and many powerful KDE applications.

group.name: KDE Multimedia Support
group.description: Multimedia support for KDE.

group.name: Large Systems Performance
group.description: Performance support tools for large systems.

group.name: Legacy UNIX Compatibility
group.description: Compatibility programs for migration from or working with legacy UNIX environments.

group.name: Legacy X Window System Compatibility
group.description: Compatibility programs for migration from or working with legacy X Window System environments.

group.name: Load Balancer
group.description: Load balancing support for network traffic.

group.name: E-mail Server
group.description: Allows the system to act as a SMTP and/or IMAP e-mail server.

group.name: Mainframe Access
group.description: Tools for accessing mainframe computing resources.

group.name: MariaDB Database Server
group.description: The MariaDB SQL database server, and associated packages.

group.description: The MariaDB SQL database client, and associated packages.

group.name: Multimedia
group.description: Audio/video framework common to desktops.

group.name: Network File System Client
group.description: Enables the system to attach to network storage.

group.name: Network Infrastructure Server
group.description: Servers for core network protocols and services, such as DHCP or DNS.

group.name: Networking Tools
group.description: Tools for configuring and analyzing computer networks.

group.name: Common NetworkManager submodules
group.description: This group contains NetworkManager submodules that are commonly used, but may not be wanted in some streamlined configurations.

group.name: Office Suite and Productivity
group.description: A full-purpose office suite, and other productivity tools.

group.name: Performance Tools
group.description: Tools for diagnosing system and application-level performance problems.

group.name: Perl Support
group.description: Perl interfaces to common libraries and functionality.

group.name: Perl for Web
group.description: Basic Perl web application support.

group.name: PHP Support
group.description: PHP web application framework.

group.name: Platform Development
group.description: Recommended development headers and libraries for developing applications to run on CentOS Linux.

group.description: The PostgreSQL SQL database server, and associated packages.

group.description: The PostgreSQL SQL database client, and associated packages.

group.name: Printing Client
group.description: Tools for printing to a local printer or a remote print server.

group.name: Print Server
group.description: Allows the system to act as a print server.

group.name: Python
group.description: Basic Python web application support.

group.name: Remote Management for Linux
group.description: Remote management interface for CentOS Linux, including OpenLMI and SNMP.

group.name: Resilient Storage
group.description: Clustered storage, including the GFS2 file system.

group.name: Ruby Support
group.description: Ruby interfaces to common libraries and functionality.

group.name: Scientific Support
group.description: Tools for mathematical and scientific computations, and parallel computing.

group.name: Security Tools
group.description: Security tools for integrity and trust verification.

group.name: Smart Card Support
group.description: Support for using smart card authentication.

group.name: System Administration Tools
group.description: Utilities useful in system administration.

group.name: System Management
group.description: Various low-level hardware management frameworks.

group.name: Technical Writing
group.description: Tools for writing technical documentation.

group.name: Virtualization Client
group.description: Clients for installing and managing virtualization instances.

group.name: Virtualization Hypervisor
group.description: Smallest possible virtualization host installation.

group.name: Virtualization Platform
group.description: Provides an interface for accessing and controlling virtualized guests and containers.

group.name: Virtualization Tools
group.description: Tools for offline virtual image management.

group.name: Web Server
group.description: Allows the system to act as a web server, and run Perl and Python web applications.

group.name: Web Servlet Engine
group.description: Allows the system to host Java servlets.

group.name: X Window System
group.description: X Window System Support.

environment.description: Server for operating network infrastructure services, with a GUI.
